pleading noun
(ASKING)

plead

pleading noun
(LEGAL STATEMENT)
[ C usually plural ]
  law
  specialized a formal written document stating the reasons for bringing a legal action against someone, or the reaction to those reasons given by the defence (= the accused person or their lawyers): The case begins when the pleadings are filed with the court. He wrote in court pleadings that the federal government is pushing a ridiculous interpretation of the law.
